page.title: 11Farms
page.content: Six farms agreed to participate in the farming survey. The sizes of the farms varied from 60 - 150 acres, the largest being the Heathcote and Morson farms. All the farms, except Grundey, said their most profitable asset was the dairy cows. Grundey's profit came from beef cattle. Cows, sheep and pigs figured also. Although no farm in our area run their farms by means of a computer most had modern farm machinery including tractors, hay makers and baler. Crops are not grown because it is very wet and, because the ground is stoney, there is no depth to the soil. Another factor is that the seasons are very late. Every farmer loved his job. The fresh air and love of the way of life was everything to them.
